1.content:
Li Hercules POV

My name is Li Hercules. My mother was from Atlantis and my father was from Utopia. We all now reside in the kingdom of Olympus. I was always very strong for my age; even as a child I could wield my father's double headed war hammer with ease. He gave it to me as a gift upon being accepted to Ares Academy. It was the most highly acclaimed school that trains young witches and mad scientists to fight the many different monsters left behind by the terrible war between the two great powers. Well, despite what history tells us, I truly believed that it was a war of three great powers. I have met many 'normal' humans who could easily hold their own in a fight against the monsters we call remnants.

What was more exciting was that I was accepted two years early due to a flawless victory in the final exam tournaments in my previous school of Spartan Academy on the island of Crete. This was a great honor in the eyes of my professors and fellow students. It was also a great responsibility. I reminded myself to stay focused when attending classes and try to stay calm in battle. I did not wish to force those who put me here to reconsider their decision; that would be a disgrace. No pressure, right?

I looked out the window of the airship carrying my fellow students and I at the mountains below that most all became active volcanoes during the terrible war. I then looked ahead and saw Ares Academy for the first time. The architects who designed it used the ancient Greek temples as their inspiration. Every aspect of it looked as if the ancient city of Rome had returned to its previous golden age but with a modern twist including a Colosseum where the tournaments were to take place.

"It's magnificent." Whispering, I muttered.

"It certainly is." Remarked a voice behind me.

I turned to find...
1.title: Li Hercules

11.content:
Kim Meridian POV

Introduction: Kim Meridian was born and raised in Olympus. Having grown up the child of two powerful magical warriors, she is under a lot of pressure to live up to their expectations. Instead, she is shy, and awkward, and she yearns for lasting peace. She feels that it might be best to reach out to the monsters, to try and understand them. Because of her doubts, she is afraid to unleash her magical potential. Now that she is sixteen years old, however, she has to choose her path in life.

~~~

I don't know why I spoke out. I guess it was the relief of having found another new student. When the boy turned around, though, I looked down at my hands. They were clutching a small bag of my belongings.

I have never been forward. Both my mother and father have an overbearing presence, each of them a genius in their own right. My father is of French heritage, my mother British. Of course, both of those once great nations have been destroyed. I only know them through stories.

Realising something more might be expected of me, I said, "Hi." And that was all I could manage.

Great start, Kim. No introduction, no questions, just "Hi". If Mom were here, she'd give me that look. The one of complete and utter disappointment. The one I should be used to by now...
11.title: Kim Meridian

112.content:
Li Hercules POV

I bowed slightly to the girl who had approached us and noticed she had mysterious crystal colored eyes that shimmered like real diamonds. It was an extremely rare trait, one that almost literally screamed powerful magic user. That with her doll like frame and near perfectly tan skin, she bared a strong presence though I somehow doubted she knew that.

"Hi." Smiling, I replied. "I am Li. Li Hercules. This is Azuma and Diana Logy."

"Kim. Kim Meridian." Bowing slightly, Kim said. "S-Sorry for the intrusion."

"There's nothing to be sorry about, Kim." Politely, Diana said. "Ares Academy is literally the hardest school to get accepted to. We are all under a lot of pressure due to high expectations from our family, friends, and former professors." She smiled. "Look at me; I'm a normal, one of the very first to ever be accepted there. Talk about pressure."

Kim smiled slightly as if relieved. "I'm hoping to make my family proud."

"We all are, Kim." Calmly, Azuma said. "I too come from a long line of powerful warriors. Still our best is all that can be expected of us." Her face turned serious. "Fear not the future and dwell not in the past; it will only distract you from the present and before you know it, the present will become the past."
112.title: Interact with Kim

1122.content:
"How did you know my name?" Curious, Azuma inquired.

I smiled, pointing at her blouse. "Your name tag, of course."

Azuma blushed slightly. She was a rather odd looking girl, one or two years older than me. Hanging from her hip was a katana style sword that looked as if it had seen a lot of action in its time. The color of the sword did not exactly match the rest of her outfit but I was not a fashion expert so I did not make mention of it. From her pale skin to her long flowing blue locks that kissed her hips, her overall appearance was unique to say the least. She was barefooted but had anklets on her legs; I guessed she was a dancer.

She kept a neutral expression as she eyed us; he yellow eyes looking everyone, especially me up and down. She tapped her elaborate lance on the floor once before tilting her head, and then saying "Mhm."

My eyes widen slightly, realizing she was waiting for me to speak. "I hail from Olympus."

The girl nods then takes my hand and shakes it, her skin is really soft. "I hail from Babylon."

"Do you have a monster that you control then?" Curious, I asked.

Azuma nodded. "Yes, it's a dragon of sorts. I can summon him at will."

"A dragon? Impressive, how were you able to tame it?" I inquire with some awe, most beasts are the simple sorts. A dragon is a rarity these days.

"It was a rampaging monster, but I used my skills to tame it. As you might have guessed by my attire I am a dancer, I am a witch as well. I used the pair in conjunction to convince it to change it's ways and follow my beck and call. My parents were so pleased by my actions that I requested I travel here." Azuma states, her expression still neutral.

I smiled politely. "That's awesome Azuma, I'm sure you'll do great. I'm kinda of a new addition here, I got moved ahead due to my abilities and talents. I hope I can live up to them."

Azuma let out a little smile, for a dancer she's not very expressive. Though that might just be due to being in her element. "Thank you Li." she says after it, something about Azuma just seems odd though. But I can't put my finger on it, then again I've just met her.

"I'm glad to hear I'm not the only student to be skipped ahead." Calmly, a Diana said.

Azuma, Kim, and I turned to Diana, curious. She was a short young girl with shoulder length auburn hair and green eyes. She wore bluejeans overalls with a long sleeve pink shirt and a red scarf hanging loosely around her neck. On her feet were heavy black boots with steel armor on the toes. She also wore black finger-less gloves. Standing next to her was a large wolf with glowing blue eyes. At first, I believed it to be a small remnant Lupus or werewolf. However, upon seeing metal under a recent slash injury, I realized that it was a robot.

"I'm Diana 'techno' Logy." With a slight bow, the girl said. "I hail from Utopia." She motioned to the robot dog. "This is Husky; my best friend and partner since I was a little girl." She giggled. "My father built him to protect me and I have been modifying him ever since."

"I see..." Calmly, Azuma said. "Are you a mad scientist then?"

Diana shook her head. "I'm a normal." Smiling, she said. "Don't underestimate me, though. I won top prize in the final exam tournaments in my kingdom over many witches and mad scientists alike." She smiled. "I was told that I am a natural fighter and a fine inventor at an early age."

"I hope you do well." Smiling, I said.

"May we all do." Smiling in return, Azuma said. "For the preservation of our world."

Diana, Kim, and I smiled in return.

121.title: Another person joins in.

1211.content:
Li Hercules POV

Upon landing at Ares academy, Azuma, Diana and I walked out onto one of the many roads leading towards the administration building just beyond the landing docks. I saw several ships arriving from all five kingdoms with people from all walks of life. Only I also took notice of an airship that seemed to stand apart from the others with a kingdom symbol I never saw before. Azuma seemed to recognize it judging from her slight wince and look of disapproval.

"You know the kingdom that airship hails from?" Curious, I asked.

Azuma shook her head. "That ship is from the newly formed mad science collective." Stress in her voice, she said. "The old order was run by a psychotic madman known as Xenon Erratic. He was mostly to blame for the start of the war and was executed for his part in it."

"What do you know of this new collective?" Darkly curious, Diana demanded.

"Not much other than a brief background." Sighing, Azuma admitted. "The family was originally witch born; the Morgana family. Only they married into the mad science collective as part of the peace process and became the Moray family. As a new 'royal' family, very little is known about them."

A muscular man in a strange military uniform walked out of the airship and called out to the people in a loud booming voice. "Announcing his royal highness, Prince Devlin Moray!"

I turned to the ship to see a boy no older than myself walking out of the ship. He was wearing an English style gentleman's suit with knee high riding boots, leather elbow length riding gloves, a top hat and a cane with a huge diamond at the top. The coat tails of his suit were unusually long and moved about as if they had a life of their own. He wore round dark glasses over his eyes and walked in a nonchalant manner that showed little concern over the stares of others.

"Thank you, Esquire." Calmly, he said. "However, I am not attending this academy to establish myself as a figure of authority but to prove myself a force for peace on this world."

Esquire bowed respectfully. "Of course, my prince." Quickly, he said.

Devlin chuckled. "Relax, old friend. You are attending this academy as well; here we are equals."

"That's unusual." Giggling, Diana commented. "A prince having to live as equals with 'commoners'?"

She jumped, a slight scream escaping her lips as Devlin suddenly appeared in front of them. Husky was between her and Devlin in the next second, giving a low growl of warning. Devlin smiled and began to gently stroke the robot wolf under its chin. It seemed to calm him for the moment.

"I apologize if I startled you." Grinning slightly, he said. "My power is elemental/weather based; I'm still working on using it with subtlety. I am hoping professor Alpha Zeus can help me with that as he possesses the same type of power." He then turned to Diana. "My title of prince holds little weight in these times, dear lady. That and this academy was not built for common people but for the extraordinary, the powerful, those who can evoke change we hope for the better."

Diana smiled. "I stand corrected."

Introductions were made and we all walked together towards the administration building where Professor Alpha Zeus was expected to give a short speech before dorm rooms were assigned.
1211.title: Arriving at Ares Academy.

12112.content:
Li Hercules POV

Professor Alpha Zeus was a tall and insanely muscular man in a black business suit wielding a staff that oddly looked like a lightning bolt. He was clean shaven with longish greying black hair and glowing white eyes that seemed to pierce into anyone he gazed at. He raised his staff slightly then touched the concrete floor making a thunderous boom which shook everyone into silence.

"Welcome, students to Ares Academy." In a booming voice he calmly said. "You were all accepted here this year for one reason only; you are the best of the best throughout Nero Earth. We have summoned the best professors and veteran warriors to help mold you into even greater guardians."

Three women, triplets, walked up to the mike. They were all professionally dressed only one carried a gold staff while the second had a silver staff and the third carried a staff of bronze. The gold woman spoke first. "Greetings, I am Alia Siren. The woman of silver is Beta Siren and the woman of bronze is Trina Siren; we are the head teachers of this academy."

"Nothing you do or say will go unnoticed." Darkly, Beta Siren said. "Good students will be rewarded while poor students will be punished. Do not test us, you will fail."

"Our door is always open to anyone who wishes to speak about a problem." Kindly, Trina said. "We are here to make you better guardians... failure to defend yourself or others can and will lead to death."

"Your initiation trials begin tomorrow at sunrise." Serious, Zeus announced. "Be ready; we will be watching every step you take."

He then raised his staff and brought it down hard. There was a thunderous boom and a flash and then they were gone, no where to be seen."

I looked about to find several teachers pointing to two buildings in the distance and followed the line the boys were making to see an odd figure in the distance. He was short with dark brown hair and narrow bright glowing blue eyes. I did not see his face but I saw that he was wearing a worn leather jacket with what appeared to be ancient Japanese symbols. I took a step towards the figure to get a closer look only he vanished as if he were a mere illusion. Zeus had said that he had summoned veteran warriors to the school; I wondered if the one I saw was one of them.

Then a strong man's voice broke my chin of thought. "Li!"

I turned to see a boy slightly older than I in a prefect uniform. "I'm coming." Sighing, I muttered. "I was just taking in the sights."

"You will have time for that after the initiation trials." Strictly, the prefect said. "Follow this path you your dorm and get some sleep. Believe me, you will need it!"
12112.title: Zeus gives a short speech.

choices: Li Hercules with his war hammer.
Diana Logy with her robot wolf.
121122.content:
Azuma's POV

I woke up the following morning feeling unusually rested and energized. It was almost as if I had months to rest and build my strength after the long journey from Babylon to Olympus. I heard Aqua purring near me and I opened my eyes only to find I was no longer in the girls dorm of the school!

"Aqua, what happened?!" Startled, I asked.

I got a mental image on a bright flash in the girl's dorm followed by the dragon catching me in mid air after I reappeared above the city ruins outside the Olympus walls. Aqua communicated through mental images, scents, and the color of her scales which change to show her emotions.

"We were all teleported here?" Worried, I asked.

Aqua snorted, giving a firm nod. He understood me perfectly through he responded in his own way, one which I learned to understand. I looked around and spotted my cypher, what used to be called a cellphone, and noticed I had a message waiting from the head master, Alpha Zeus. I activated the message and a hologram of Zeus appeared in front of us.

"Greetings, student and welcome to your initiation trial." Calmly, he said. "You and all of the other first year students have been teleported into the walls of this ruins city."

"This is bad." Worried and annoyed, I muttered. "The remnant monsters are sure to know we are here in the city with a teleport that size!"

"Your mission is simple." Remaining calm, Zeus said. "You must find three other first year students and return to Ares Academy alive. You must find or make your own way through the walls of Olympus without any remnant monsters following." He frowned. "Do not hesitate to kill any monster you encounter or you will be killed. Good luck."

The hologram then vanished and I turned to Aqua. "Well, it looks like we need to save some lives before breakfast, old friend." Sighing, I said.

Aqua gave a short snort that sounded like a sigh causing me to smile. "Let's get this done."

Before we could even start, we heard a loud crash followed by a Kangobra, or a Kangaroo/cobra monster flying through a gaping hole in the wall into the far wall from us with a sick thud! It slid to the floor leaving a trail of green blood on the wall where it had hit. I looked out the hole to find a lone warrior standing in the street.

I recognized this warrior. It was...
121122.title: A cruel initiation.

1211221.content:
Li Hercules POV

The Kangobra had caught me by surprise but one hit from Thor, my war hammer, send it flying into a gaping hole in one of the abandoned buildings where I heard it slam into the wall with a satisfying crunch. "Boom, you're dead." Grinning, I said.

Then a familiar voice yelled out, "Hey! Watch it!"

I looked up and saw Azuma looking down at me with a rather annoyed look on her face with her dragon, Aqua looking down at me as well. Apparently, the gaping hole lead to a rather huge room, likely an old parking garage. I blushed slightly, rubbing the back of my neck to massage away my embarrassment.

"Um... Sorry about that!" With a nervous grin, I said. "At least we have some breakfast now."

Azuma looked at me as if she were about to be sick. "You eat remnant monsters?!" Distaste in her voice, she asked. "That's disgusting!"

"I was raised to get my meal where ever I can." Serious, I said. "The meat of a Kangobra is filled with more nutrients than any cow you can slaughter. That and the poison of its cobra tail will kill most remnant monsters in seconds. I keep a vial of it to put on Thor when I face a powerful enemy such as an undead warrior or super zombie."

Azuma looked at me for a moment then smiled. "Oh; you call your weapon Thor." She leaped down from the hole with Aqua following. "We have no time to eat, though. We must find the others and get them back to Olympus."

"We need to find two others and get back to Olympus." Firmly, I countered. "Look, I want to save as many lives as we can too but small groups have a better chance of making it back alive. We find two others, take them back then search for more."

Azuma nodded. "Agreed."
1211221.title: Li Hercules with his war hammer.

choices: Another warrior attacks the Hawk wolves.
We fight the hawk wolf pack.
12112211.content:
Li Hercules POV

Azuma and I began our search from the rooftops of the buildings with Aqua flying above to offer support when needed. We both kept our ears and eyes open for any other students and for remnant monsters that could literally spring up from anywhere.

"It won't be easy finding anyone in an abandoned city this size." Frowning, I said. "It was sheer luck that you and I found each other."

"Don't be so dramatic." Smiling slightly, Azuma said. "We just need to listen for sounds of battle. The others are bound to encounter the remnant monsters just as we did."

As if on cue, the sounds of battle exploded in a near by street. I leaped off the roof I was on, sailing across the wide alley onto the next roof! Azuma was right behind, launching herself into the air with a graceful leap on a spout of water around her bare feet! "Wow..." Seeing her land, I muttered.

Azuma grinned then pointed down at the adjoining street. We looked down to find Diana Logy fighting a pack of Hawk wolves with her robot wolf, Husky at her side. She bared a pair of metallic claws on bracelets which she used to slash at the Hawk wolves along with a light but razor sharp sword. Still, the two were greatly out numbered and they both looked to be injured.

"We need to get down there!" Leaping up onto the ledge, I yelled. "They need help!"

Azuma nodded. "Agreed!"

I leaped from the roof with Thor raised high, giving a battle cry!
12112211.title: The search begins.

121122112.content:
Azuma's POV

I'm in battle once again, I'm no stranger to the way of war. Since I could walk I recall holding a lance in my hands, my dance steps were taught with this weapon in my hand. Even before I met Aqua, my parents are rich. Nobles if you will, my role as a dancer was to entertain those who would meet us. But those routines were also to teach me how to gracefully fight against those who would stand to harm me, a spin without the lance was used later when I had it to deflect attacks rather than block them.

In my lands it's custom that those who are to fight are to have a beast of some sort to aid them in battle, Aqua was the one I got. Not because it was given to me, but rather because I tamed him. It was thanks to my magic abilities, moreso my ability to produce water from thin air regardless of how thin it is. I can of course use other spells. Aqua was given his name because I tamed him by giving him water, he hadn't drank for days.

I leap from the roof alongside Li, though I descend more slowly and gracefully. Using my magic to aid in my fall, one of the hawk wolves sees me and wastes no time in trying to charge at me. Leaping into the air, only to be grabbed in mid air by Aqua who flew in and grabbed it with his talons. He then proceeded to lift it into his mouth and took a killing bite out of it.

Mentally I give my thanks and land on the ground, the pavement solid under my bare feet. My lance spinning around in my hands as I gracefully enter my stance, no sooner do I prepare myself does one of the monster's come running towards me. I perform a move in response, using a burst of water above myself as I did earlier. My body moves upside down as I do this, and on instinct I stab my lance downwards. The hawk wolf is stabbed straight through the head, one simple impalement right on the head. I use another burst of water to continue flipping myself up through the air, on cue Aqua flies under me.

I get mounted onto Aqua, from here I can take to the skies. Above I ready my lance, and fling it from my higher position. It impales a beast that was about to strike Li from behind, he quickly turns and looks at it before shouting his thanks. He is skilled in combat, no question. But he lacks experience, he is younger than me I recall.

Eventually the last of the pack decide to cut and run, I land with Aqua and dismount. A pat on the head and Aqua vanishes in a puff of blue fog, I've used my magic to dismiss him back to where he stays at the academy. He can come back in a moment's notice though. "Are you hurt Ms Diana?" I inquire.

She gives a relieved sigh and pets her robot wolf before nodding "A few scrapes, nothing else though. Thanks for the save Azuma and Li, let's stick together then yeah?"

Li nods and replies with "Sounds wise, I'll take point. Let's keep moving while these things are licking their wounds." I can't argue with that logic, Li has a good grasp of the situation. I move to grab my lance and follow behind.
121122112.title: We fight the hawk wolf pack.

Devlin teleports us into the city.
1211221121.content:
Li Hercules POV

"Hawk wolves are a persistent danger." Serious, I explained. "When a pack is diminished by an enemy, like us, they seek out and either join or take over another pack to regain their strength in numbers."

"So, if you don't kill the entire pack..." Worried, Diana said.

"They will attack you immediately if you meet them again." Darkly, I said. "That is what makes them one of the most feared remnant monsters on Nero Earth."

"We still need one other member in our group." Keeping watch, Azuma said. "We can enter Olympus through the river that feeds the city's water supply."

"The catacombs would be a better route." Serious, Diana countered. "They are a huge maze of underground tunnels the normal population used to plan and execute their attacks during the terrible war."

"I heard they go on for thousands of kilometers, linking every major city in what was once called Europe." Serious, I said. "I doubt they are all still sealed from the outside though." I sighed. "They are no doubt teeming with Remnant monsters."

"No, they are quite secure." Startling us, a new voice said.

I whipped around to find a tall, dark teenager. He sported an eighteenth century gentleman's suit with unusually long coat tails that moved about on their own as if they have a mind of their own. He was wearing knee high riding boots, a top hat covering his raven black hair, and carried a silver tipped cane with a large diamond. His eyes were hidden behind round shining glasses.

"Who are you?!" Annoyed to be caught off guard, I demanded.

The young man responded with a toothy, almost sinister grin. "I am... Prince Devlin Moray of the new mad scientist collective." Bowing slightly, he said. "I too am a student at Ares Academy so please do not bow before me." He gave a mad chuckle before adding, "I have no yet earned that privilege."

I grunted. I knew that a new mad science collective and witch coven were created after the war but no one knew who was at the top or what either of their intentions were. Devlin's mere presence made me feel rather uneasy. "May I assume you wish to join our group?" Softly, I asked.

"That is the point of this deadly challenge." Smiling, Devlin said. "The new river, Odin is the most direct path into Olympus but it requires you dive into the bottomless lake named Leviathan's lair." He smiled again. "Although the catacombs are secure, they are home to small bands of insane normals who are convinced the war is still raging on as well as a few trapped mad scientists and witches who are just as unstable as the normals."

"What do you suggest then?" Raising an eyebrow, Azuma inquired.

Devlin flashed his toothy grin. "I can teleport us all back into the city." Simply, he said. "This way, no monsters can follow."

I had to admit that I had no idea as to how to enter the city just yet. It was not because I knew of no way, it was that we could not allow any remnant monsters to follow us in. I turned to the others who all took a vote as to how to enter the city...
1211221121.title: Continue

12112211211.content:
Li's POV

I've had a think on it, the direct route might be the best course of action. After all we know where it'll take us, for the most part. Bottomless lake aside. The catacombs are too risky, yes they're secure. But will be tight and have crazy people wandering about that would make things too unpredictable. Devlin sounds confident that his teleporter could work, but what if monsters attacked us at the last second. They'd most likely be taken with us, but an idea comes to mind for me regarding the direct route.

"Hey Azuma?" I say.

The blue haired dancer blinks at me and gives a "Hm." noise to ask what I'm wanting from her.

"You can manipulate water can't you? With your magic?" I ask.

Azuma nods and says "Well in theory anyone with magic could, though I do know how to use it quite a bit yes. It's done with my routines as a dancer. Why do you ask Li?"

I get an idea, and snap my fingers. I say "We could use that to go through the bottomless lake."

Diana then says "But I hear it's called Leviathan's lair for a reason. Myth has it there's a giant monster there that eats people who go in there."

"Perhaps, what are we getting at here Li?" Devlin asks.

"Azuma could take us through that lake and directly into Olympus, using her water control to form an air bubble around us as we go through the water. Least that was what I was thinking, it's the most direct route." I say.

The dancer is silent, thinking this through. I know I'm putting a bit of a challenge on her petite shoulders, though Azuma nods and says "It's possible, I've never done something like that before. Though I can manipulate water very well, what your asking with regards to the air bubble though seems quite difficult."

"I have something that should help, if we are to indeed submerge ourselves in the water then here. Each of you take one of these." I get my knuckle dusters ready and close my eyes, searching through the depths of my soul. As I have done many times to awaken the power within me, the forms that I can take appear in shards of glass.

I select the nearest one.

http://lparchive.org/Shadow-Hearts-Coven...

"I am Vastitas! I am that which has skin as hard as Earth, use Gaia's wrath to protect yourself and crush those who have strayed from the path!" the form shouts at me, instantly I feel stone cover my body. A bestial roar emerges from my mouth as I leap into the air, bringing my fists down onto the nearest deader. Smashing it's head into complete mush, spraying viscera and gore amongst the ruined pavements. Another one to my left is grabbed by me, followed by me driving my right fist into it's gut and then tossing it to the side.

Valeria leaps high, throwing daggers at the feet of the monsters too far for me to engage up close. Then suddenly explosions are seen, must have been rigged on her knifes. Nina rushes past me and swings her weapon with a sadistic grin on her lips. My mind is focusing on the combat, I need to stay focused. My transformations come with a down side, my mental state is still technically human. My body however isn't, and the former can't handle the latter.

So staying too long in my monster forms results in me going berserk, but I've gotten used to it. I can last up to half an hour before I really need to go back to being normal, the last time well.....I don't talk about it.

Cire joins the scrap, saying something or another. Again I don't focus on it, only on crushing these monsters using my power. This is one form I can go into, there's others. Some I can do, others I don't. The voice in my head tells me when I get them.

Eventually the deaders are all gone, all over the place still though. In parts that is, I shut my eyes. Feeling a flash of light before I look down, seeing my usual arms. Giving a huff I lightly crack the neck before saying "I hate fighting chumps."

"Oh? Still they should have felt honoured to be able to face your transformed self Bosara." Nina says, flicking her lavender hair with a hand that trails down to her chest.

"We should get going guys, Valeria's explosions might attract more of those things." Cire mutters, Valeria looks sheepish and stands a bit closer to me.

Saying nothing I put my knuckle dusters away and start walking away from the chaos I just helped make, seems like fighting is all I'm really good at. But if I can help make this place better then I will, otherwise that voice will shout me till I snap my own neck.

13.content:
Blake Mars POV

My name is Blake Mars, someone that in this messed up world would consider 'normal', and to say that my life so far is uninteresting is an extreme understatement. I currently live in Atlantis, though before that, I was on exchange in what was the east coast of Australia. Something that I never would had done if I knew what was to come. I may look like a typical seventeen year old girl, but I have a dark secret. Several in fact. The first is that I am older than the seventeen years I appear to be since I can vaguely remember the start of the war. I'm not too sure how old I was back then, but what I can remember was that during the early days, I was injected with something. Not sure what that cloaked figure was trying to do, or even why as there were plenty of already unpleasant and dangerous wildlife he or she could had experimented on, but the results were that it seemed to stop my physical aging at the late teens and it also turned me into a girl.

I spent years trying to survive the horrors (someone had the 'smart' idea of mutating a kangaroo with some type of snake along with other constructs to fight, then counter-fight that monstrosity and though my changes made me nearly indestructible, I still could feel pain), and even longer dealing with the changes to myself. I eventually found myself on Atlantis after it appeared rescuing me and a few other survivors about ten years ago, and since then, I tried to keep a low profile. Which proved impossible. While my true age and past was kept hidden, even from the other survivors, the fact I haven't aged a day has made me a curiosity. Which is why, along with several other reasons why I came here. I muttered something regarding the architecture, which was a mistake as it drew attention to myself.

A boy came up to me almost immediately, an started eyeing me, much to my annoyance. "Okay. I get the message" the boy said as he saw my distasteful look.

"Sorry. I'm just tired" I said. "Blake Mars."

"Li Hercules. Seen anything like this?" the boy asked, in awe.

"A long time ago" I said, not wanting to go into details.

"Hey, that's that?" Li asked, as he noticed the antique pistol hat was strapped to my hip. It was of course, heavily modified.

"This is Deimos" I said.

Li gave a slight laugh. "Mars and Deimos. Cute"

Blake Mars POV

"I will not." Calmly, Chan said. "I am Chan Koy from the isle of Scott. I am a teacher at Spartan Academy in Olympus."

Chan lifted his blindfold, revealing two brightly glowing blue eyes. There was a power behind them that forced even me to quiver in fright. Upon placing the blindfold back into position, Chan said, "When distracted, the present will become the past before you decide to act upon it."

Li smiled. "I got the beating of my life that day because I allowed my ego to control my decisions." Blushing, Li said. "I took that lesson to heart and here I am, attending Ares Academy two years early."

1311.content:
Li Hercules POV

Professor Chan approached us with the aid of a cane. He was a tall muscular man in a black business suit with a red sash covering his eyes, tied behind his head. His cane was unusually large; I suspected it hid a large sword or was able to change into something else.

"Good morning, students." In a nonchalant manner, he said. "Welcome to Ares Academy. I will be your zero-light combat instructor; you will learn to fight in pitch darkness before you graduate."

Zero light was a new phenomenon; an effect of the terrible war. Different parts of the world experience times of complete darkness due to low hanging clouds of dark magic or psychotic fog. Anyone caught in these clouds or fog face untold dangers. Those who do not how to fight them are rarely seen or heard from again and those who do return are never the same. Our world was facing dark times even so long after the terrible war had ended. The remnant monsters were just one of the many dangers we faced in this new world.

"It is good to see you again, Professor Chan." Bowing, I said. "I must admit, I am surprised you transferred to Ares Academy to teach."

"I teach at many schools, Li." Bowing back, Chan said. "I was asked to come to Ares as we have many promising students this year including a few normals who have surprised us all."

"Normal people are being accepted to Ares Academy?" Surprised, Blake asked. "They must truly be impressive fighters."

"A warrior does not necessarily require magic or super science to defeat an enemy, Blake." Politely, Chan said. "Do not forget; it was an army of normal people who forced the end of the terrible war."

"You did not strike me as a historian." Bemused, Blake said.

Chan smiled. "I did not strike myself as one either." Honestly, he replied. "However, history and experience are the hardest of all teachers."

Blake nodded. "They both test you first, then teach."

"The school has separate dorms for the girls and boys." Changing the subject, Chan said. "The Hebe building is for the boys and the Artemis building is for the girls." He smiled slightly. "I do not recommend any boy attempting to sneak into the girl's dorm, you will not like the results."

"Um... I thought most people were immune to transgender transformations." Wincing, I said.

Blake giggled slightly as Chan smiled. "Some are." Cryptically, he said. "However, anyone who enters the building set for one gender will automatically find themselves wearing all the appropriate attire."

"Very few know if they are immune or not." Amused, Blake said.

Professor Chan's grin turned sinister. "Those who are not immune to transformations will get an extra surprise that will last until graduation." Calmly, he said. "So everyone must ask themselves, is such an invasion of privacy worth the risk of a possible permanent gender reassignment?"

A number of boys on the airship gulped, including myself. Then Chan added, "The safe guard works both ways, ladies. Don't get any ideas of raiding the boy's dorm unless you wish to take the risk of being one of the boys until graduation."

As his words sank in, the airship came down to a landing at in front of the school where a tall powerful man was waiting with the aid of a lighting bolt shaped cane. With him were three identically dressed women with the exception of three different colored uniforms. As I walked out into the morning sun, I recognized the man as the headmaster of Ares Academy, Professor Alpha Zeus. The man tapped his cane onto the ground, making a deafening thunder like sound. It got everyone's attention immediately!
1311.title: Professor Chan.

13111.content:
"Students, welcome to Ares Academy." Calmly, he said. His voice was deep and booming through the microphone. "You have all been chosen to attend this year because you each possess great promise and impressive skills." He motioned to Professor Chan. "We have recruited the finest teachers from all of Nero Earth to mold you into even greater warriors and teams that we hope will be worthy of legend."

He took a step back as one of the triplet women took over the microphone. "Students, I am Alia Siren. To my left is Beta Siren and to my right is Trina Siren." Serious, she said. "We are the head teachers of this academy; nothing any of you do or say will go unnoticed. Do not test us, you will fail."

Beta stepped forward taking the microphone. "Good deeds will be rewarded with good merits." Calmly, she said. "Grand or epic deeds will win you equally grand or epic perks." She then frowned. "The same applies to the opposite."

Finally Trina took the microphone. "You will all be randomly tested with situations you may encounter in the field at random times." Darkly, she said. "If you succeed, you will re rewarded. If you fail... you will be hurt or worse; this is not a world for the weak and this school follows that example."

Zeus then took back the microphone. "Knowledge and experience is only useful if you live to use it." Coldly, he said. "You must make use of all that you are, not just parts of who you are to survive. You are here to learn how to make it all work in harmony." He paused then stated, "Your initiation exam begins tomorrow at sunrise... Be ready, students."

With that, he and the triplets walked away while other professors began to lead students to their respective dorms.

choices: Azuma meets Li following this dance.
131111.content:
Li Hercules POV

I've gotten pretty much everything unpacked now, I didn't bring much aside from my clothes and my weapon. In spite of the elaborate weapon that I wield me and my folks don't have much, but my Mother said sometimes it's for the best. I sigh as I sit on my bed, I'm honestly prepared to call it a night. It was a long travel from where I'm from, big day tomorrow after all. I don't know what will happen, I'll face a lot of monsters. That much I can tell.

Oddly though I hear noises from outside in my dorm, guys are moving out in droves. That's odd, shouldn't we all be winding down?

"What's going on?" I ask the nearest guy.

"Dude don't you know? Azuma's performing for us all before the night is out! She's a really good signer, people travelled to Babylon just to hear her perform. C'mon!" with that he heads out the door.

Is Azuma really that popular? From what I heard Babylon's got a lot of sand around it, now exactly the best to travel through in these times. What the heck I might as well go, maybe Azuma will notice me there. I get my shoes on and head out, I'm just following the crowd. It looks like we're all going to where Zeus had performed his speech not too long ago, we all proceed to take seats.

I managed to get a good middle row one, right in the centre. There's a hubbub of chatter all over the place.

"I heard this girl tamed a dragon!" one voice I overhear says.

"I saw her earlier, she didn't really seem that expressive."

To be honest I sorta thought that too. But then suddenly a spotlight appears on the stage, and emerging through a curtain is Azuma. Dressed in her usual outfit only minus her lance, she walks calmly to the middle of the stage. Her expression neutral as she scans the crowd, but Azuma makes eye contact with me. And a little smile graces her lips.

Then the music begins to play, and then I hear her sing.......

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fBFWOEdx...

In the White Light.......A hand reaches through......A double edged blade cuts your heart in two.....

Wow......so.....beautiful. Azuma goes through some dancing motions as she sings, and using her magic trails of water flow from her hands as she performs. As she spins Azuma actually makes water fly above us, coating the ceiling above with an ethereal blue glow. Which earns loud cheers from us all, following the changing of the top back to normal the stage was then covered in darkness.

A snap of the fingers was heard from the stage, and the lights went back on. With Azuma now wearing a dark purple version of her outfit, must have been changed with magic quickly. She now has a see through veil over her mouth as well.

Embrace the dark........You call a home.....Gaze upon an empty white throne!

This dance that she's doing now is far more passionate, the use of her water magic is there too. The crowd is cheering even louder, I'm doing the same now too. Wow, I can really see why Azuma is a very noted figure of Babylon. Her magic and moves are all well performed, the ethereal water she conjures is swirled around us before flying upwards and flowing all around Azuma in slow motion.

After another minute of this Azuma concludes her dance, ending in a very elegant bow. We all give a very loud round of applause to which she rises up and removes her veil to give a very wide grin. It changes to a warm smile when her gaze falls to me though, and I can't help but give a little chuckle before returning it.
131111.title: Sing with me~

131112.content:
Li Hercules POV

Well that's it then, I'm a member of this school now. To be honest it's still a bit surreal that I'm here, seems like just yesterday I was wondering if I'd be coming here in a few years only to find that I'm here now. I got set up at my dorm, I've got my own room. I dumped my stuff there, but I'm feeling a bit restless. Maybe it's just my nerves acting up on me, we've been given free time now and curfew's not till a bit. There's a nice lake not too far from the school, taken care of and everything. The sun's already set, black night now. But there's a couple of hours left, so I feel content to simply wander there.

I head down the path to the lake, cobbled stones with some lampposts to light the way. The path gives way to a wooden sort of dock, there's a few signs saying not to feed the fish and that the water's deep and so on. As I make way to it though I realise that I'm not alone, in the far off part of the lake is Azuma. Still dressed as she usually is, her bare legs dipping into the water. She's looking into the water, at her own reflection with a sense of hidden awe on her face.

The next thing I know she begins hovering, no doubt using magic to propel herself upwards. Azuma then stops, her feet staying on the top of the water but doesn't go downwards. She holds the elaborate lance in her hands, it doesn't seem like she's noticed me yet. But then all of a sudden I hear a loud roar from behind me and the noise of a heavy thud, I quickly turn around and a sort of dragon monster right in front of me!

http://static1.gamespot.com/uploads/scre...

I fall down, though I'm not falling into the water thankfully. Shit, I don't have my weapon on me. I left it at the dorm, the monster roars at me again and lifts it's front legs up but then.......

"Aqua! Heel!" Azuma's elegant voice shouts above the din, the monster pauses and then stands normally. Before simply lying on it's belly and huffing at me. I turn around to see Azuma walking across the lake's waters, nearly gliding over the surface of it.

She does that head tilt of hers again, letting some of her long blue locks of hair go to the front of her head. A second later Azuma speaks with "Li, I didn't notice you. Aqua was summoned by me to become accustomed to his new home, as am I."

I cough politely, after a brief pause I say "I saw you had a look of wonder on you when you waded into the lake, is it because of where you are from?"

Azuma nods and replies with "Babylon is surrounded by the desert, the sands help ward off intruders. But it obviously limits water, it's why I am highly praised there. For I can use my magic to produce water from thin air, but a lake is something I've never been present to."

As if to prove her ability Azuma traces her lance's tip in the air, it glows and water traces along it before dropping into the lake. "Woah.....that's incredible Azuma, do you incorporate it into your dancing?" I inquire.

The girl responds with "Yes, it helped me tame Aqua. He hadn't partaken of water in ages, I gave him his name as a fitting thing for him. I apologize Li, but I think I will retire for tonight. Aqua, vanish....." Azuma stands to the creature's head and placed her hand on it's forehead.

In response the dragon purrs, before slowly fading away in a pure white light into her hand. The dancer gives me a small smile before walking up the path, I figured I'd go with her. Least till we have to part ways.

"Are you worried about the trails that will come Azuma?" I ask as we go back up the path.

"Of course, but I'm confident in my abilities and Aqua. What of you Li?" she responds, Azuma didn't seem the least bit concerned. Then again she's not really emotive, but if she were in her element I strongly believe she would be.

"Same here, I can handle myself in most situations. But still......ack there's no point thinking about it. Better just go and get some rest. I'm going this way, Azuma your over there correct?" I say as I point to one road that the path splits into.

Azuma nods and gives a small bow before saying "Indeed, goodnight Li." with that the dancer departs, though I catch the briefest smile on her face as she turns. Was it a trick of the light? Nah couldn't be, but it's something to remember at least.

1311121.content:
Li Hercules POV

The following morning, I woke up feeling refreshed and energized. Only, to my surprise and horror, I was no longer in the boy's dorm or Ares Academy! I was in a small room somewhere in the city ruins about ten miles outside the walls of the Olympus kingdom! I knew this because I could see the kingdom just beyond the old city walls! I frantically looked about and was relieved to find Thor, my double headed war-hammer lying next to me. I spotted my cypher, what used to be called a cellphone, next to Thor and picked it up. I had a message waiting; it was from Alpha Zeus, the headmaster. I pressed the play button and a hologram of Zeus appeared standing before me.

"Greetings, student." Calmly, Zeus said. "You and every last other new student was transported into the walls of this city outside of the kingdom for your initiation test."

"Great!" Huffing, I muttered. "What kind of test is this?!"

"You task is simple; find three other students and return them to the kingdom alive." Calmly, Zeus continued. "You must find your own way in without allowing any remnant monsters to follow. Do not hesitate to kill the monsters you encounter or you will be killed."

The hologram then vanished. "That is just perfect!" Annoyed, I said. "I didn't even get my first cup of ale and I have to fight monsters to find three other students and take them back to Olympus!"

I was particularly grumpy without my first cup of ale as it helped sooth my nerves for the day ahead. Still, I understood the meaning behind the test. Before the kingdoms were built, in the times just after the war, no one slept well and often had to search for comrades or loved ones in the morning as they were stolen in the night by the remnant monsters.

"Well, I better get started." Taking Thor into my hand, I said. "I just hope Blake, Azuma and Diana are okay out there; maybe we'll meet each other during my search."

I knew of Diana through rumors at Spartan Academy, she was one of the first normal humans to be accepted to Ares Academy with a robot wolf her father had built for her. Azuma I briefly met while getting on the airship transport. She seemed nice but very quiet. Placing my thoughts aside, I walked to a gaping hole in the wall to the ruins of the city. It was an eerily quiet morning which placed me upon my guard. There was no doubt the remnants knew there were humans in the city and were on the hunt for us. It was only a matter of time before I would encounter one of them.

I leaped out of the room onto the street and scanned the area for any other students...

info.description:
Background:

On a world known as Nero Earth, there was a vicious war between witches and mad scientists that devastated the entire world. Monsters were made by the powers of both supernatural and super science. The general public at large fought back and eventually won, ending the war. Only civilization as we know it was left in ruin and chaos.

One century after the war, civilization rose again into five great kingdoms in a much changed world. The five great kingdoms were:

Olympus in New-Europe.

Olympus rests in the high mountains of Eastern Europe. It is surrounded and protected by active volcanoes that now rumble out of control. There is an equal split of magical and technological warriors.

Atlantis in Oceania

Atlantis is a 'glass' domed kingdom that rests on an artificial island that can vanish and appear anywhere on or below the seven oceans of Nero Earth. It primarily rests in the North Atlantic. Their warriors rely heavy on technology but they have a few magical warriors.

El Dorado in the Amazon Jungle.

El Dorado rests in the Amazon Jungle. It is protected by the dense jungle and the monsters that reside there. Their warriors rely heavily upon magic but they have a few technological warriors.

Babylon in the Great Deserts

Babylon rests in the great deserts of the Middle East. It is protected by the desert and the monsters who reside there. It's people work to regain control of the monsters left behind by the terrible war. Some of their efforts have paid off but it is considered a futile task by many in the other kingdoms. Still, they are greatly respected for their accomplishments. Their magical and technological warriors each have one 'tamed' monster working along side them.

Utopia of Soviet

Utopia rests in the great cold expanse of what was once known as Siberia. It is a tropical oasis that should not exist in such hostile conditions but it does. It is protected by the barren. This kingdom is a technological magic realm that believes technology fused with magic is the key to protecting the peace. Their warriors have weapons that use both magic and mad science.


Story:

This story focuses on the Olympus kingdom where the head master of Ares Academy is named Professor Alpha Zeus. The head teacher is named Alia Siren; she is one of a set of triplets. Her two sisters are also teachers, Beta Siren and Trina Siren. (reference to the three sirens or masters of fate in Greek Mythology.)

The first character introduced is named Li Hercules. (Li is Chinese in origin meaning strength) This boy of fourteen had a European mother and a Chinese father. He is polite but has a hot temper and is not afraid of a fight. He carries a double headed war-hammer as a weapon which can fire bolts of electricity on one end and magical blasts on the other on top of being a heavy blunt instrument. He possesses incredible strength and endurance but he is only average when it comes to speed.

Rules:

1. You may create and play any character of yours or other person's design. Follow the above example to introduce any new character. This character my come from any of the five kingdoms listed above or even a new kingdom. Use the above kingdom descriptions as an example to introduce the new kingdom. If this character plays out well, I will add the new kingdom to the list.

2. Do not kill off any character without a good reason! Make the death of a warrior have meaning!

3. When playing any character start the chapter using the following opening line:
(Character's name) POV

4. All chapters are in the first person (I, me, myself, etc.) See rule 3.

5. Be descriptive but not graphic regardless of the content of any given chapter. Any entry that qualifies as graphic or offensive will be deleted without notice!

6. You may create any monster of magic or technological origin. However, try to be original when naming them. Examples: 1. Undead warrior: A technological monster made from the remnants of corpses. (Frankenstein's monster 2. Super Zombie: A seven foot zombie with magical weapons from the war.

7. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to email me and ask!

Have fun!
